title: Maharashtra opens Rs 800 crore centre to fight cybercrime
description: The Rs 800 crore facility, located in Navi Mumbai, will house over 150 experts to protect the state's residents. The center will leverage advanced technologies like AI and blockchain to address various types of cyber threats, including malware, deepfakes, and cryptocurrency scams.
content: Maharashtra on Friday opened a Rs 800-crore cybercrime command and control centre where more than 150 cybercrime, forensics and technology experts will work to protect the state’s 130-million residents from digital fraud.Located in Navi Mumbai, the facility, built by L&T Technology Services (LTTS) for the Maharashtra State Cyber Department, will serve as a central location to resolve cybercrime complaints from 50 districts.A helpline number – 14407 – will be operational from October 15 for citizens and enterprises to lodge their grievances.State deputy chief minister Devendra Phadnavis inaugurated the centre.“This is the largest and one-of-its-kind cyber command centre which will integrate all silos into a comprehensive, end-to-end technology solution aimed at reducing response time to cybercrime,” Yashasvi Yadav, special inspector general of police, Maharashtra cyber department, told ET.
